comments.text:
Homemade Apple Pie Steps:

Ingredients
Crust: 2 (9-inch) pie crusts (homemade or store-bought)
Apples: 6–8 cups (peeled, cored, and 1/4-inch sliced) – Granny Smith, Honeycrisp, or a mix are recommended
Sugar: 1/2 cup granulated sugar and 1/4 cup packed light brown sugar
Thickener: 1/4 cup all-purpose flour or cornstarch
Spices & Flavor: 1 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 1 tbsp lemon juice
Fat: 2 tbsp unsalted butter, cubed (for dotting)
Finish: 1 large egg + 1 tbsp milk (for egg wash), coarse sugar (optional) 
Step-by-Step Instructions
1. Prepare the Crust
If making homemade, combine flour, salt, and chilled butter, then add ice-cold water until the dough just holds together.
Divide into two disks, wrap in plastic, and chill for at least 1 hour.
On a floured surface, roll out one disk to a 12-inch circle and place it in a 9-inch pie plate. 
2. Prepare the Filling
Peel, core, and slice apples to 1/4-inch thickness.
In a large bowl, toss apple slices with lemon juice, sugars, flour (or cornstarch), cinnamon, and nutmeg until well coated.
Tip: Let the mixture sit for 20 minutes to allow the spices to penetrate. 
3. Assemble the Pie
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C) or 425°F (220°C) depending on your recipe.
Spoon the apple filling into the bottom crust, mounding slightly in the center.
Dot the top of the apples with small pieces of butter.
Roll out the second disk of dough and place it on top of the filling.
Trim excess dough, seal the edges by pinching or fluting, and cut 4–5 slits in the top for steam ventilation.
Brush the top crust with egg wash and sprinkle with sugar. 
4. Bake the Pie
Place the pie on a rimmed baking sheet (to catch leaks) on the lower-middle rack.
Bake at 400°F–425°F for 15-25 minutes, then reduce oven temp to 350°F–375°F for another 40-50 minutes.
Tip: Cover the edges with a pie shield or foil if they brown too quickly.
The pie is done when the crust is deep golden brown and the filling is bubbling through the vents. 
5. Cool and Serve
Place the pie on a wire rack and let it cool for at least 3 hours. Note: Cutting into a warm pie will result in runny filling´´´´´´

comments.text:
SML Idea: Jeffy Unhuman

A test is run on jeffy in which jeffy has no interactions with anyone for years, in a small room with water and a bed, and everything is documented on a security camera. It is a test to see if humans are dependent on parents and others. When jeffy is let out of the room he is feral and doesn't recognize anyone anymore, and slowly has to regain his memories like how to walk and talk

this is based off a game called pikabuu unhuman or smth
